text: And what possible claim could the Miss Dashwoods , who were related to him only by half blood , which she considered as no relationship at all , have on his generosity to so large an amount . text: An annuity is a very serious business ; it comes over and over every year , and there is no getting rid of it . You are not aware of what you are doing . text: His understanding was good , and his education had given it solid improvement . But he was neither fitted by abilities nor disposition to answer the wishes of his mother and sister , who longed to see him distinguished -- as -- they hardly knew what . They wanted him to make a fine figure in the world in some manner or other . His mother wished to interest him in political concerns , to get him into parliament , or to see him connected with some of the great men of the day . Mrs. John Dashwood wished it likewise ; but in the mean while , till one of these superior blessings could be attained , it would have quieted her ambition to see him driving a barouche .

text: I love him already . " " I think you will like him , " said Elinor , " when you know more of him . " " Like him ! " replied her mother with a smile .
text_tokenized: I love him already . " " I think you will like him , " said Elinor , " when you know more of him . " " Like him ! " replied her mother with a smile .

text: " I feel no sentiment of approbation inferior to love . " " You may esteem him .
text_tokenized: " I feel no sentiment of approbation inferior to love . " " You may esteem him .

text: " I have never yet known what it was to separate esteem and love . " Mrs. Dashwood now took pains to get acquainted with him . Her manners were attaching , and soon banished his reserve . She speedily comprehended all his merits ; the persuasion of his regard for Elinor perhaps assisted her penetration ; but she really felt assured of his worth : and even that
text_tokenized: " I have never yet known what it was to separate esteem and love . " Mrs. Dashwood now took pains to get acquainted with him . Her manners were attaching , and soon banished his reserve . She speedily comprehended all his merits ; the persuasion of his regard for Elinor perhaps assisted her penetration ; but she really felt assured of his worth : and even that

text: quietness of manner , which militated against all her established ideas of what a young man 's address ought to be , was no longer uninteresting when she knew his heart to be warm and his temper affectionate .
text_tokenized: quietness of manner , which militated against all her established ideas of what a young man 's address ought to be , was no longer uninteresting when she knew his heart to be warm and his temper affectionate .

text: No sooner did she perceive any symptom of love in his behaviour to Elinor , than she considered their serious attachment as certain , and looked forward to their marriage as rapidly approaching .
text_tokenized: No sooner did she perceive any symptom of love in his behaviour to Elinor , than she considered their serious attachment as certain , and looked forward to their marriage as rapidly approaching .

text: " In a few months , my dear Marianne . " said she , " Elinor will , in all probability be settled for life .
text_tokenized: " In a few months , my dear Marianne . " said she , " Elinor will , in all probability be settled for life .

text: We shall miss her ; but SHE will be happy .
text_tokenized: We shall miss her ; but SHE will be happy .

text: " Oh !
text_tokenized: " Oh !

text: Mamma , how shall we do without her ? "
text_tokenized: Mamma , how shall we do without her ? "

text: " My love , it will be scarcely a separation .
text_tokenized: " My love , it will be scarcely a separation .

text: We shall live within a few miles of each other , and shall meet every day of our lives .
text_tokenized: We shall live within a few miles of each other , and shall meet every day of our lives .

text: You will gain a brother , a real , affectionate brother .
text_tokenized: You will gain a brother , a real , affectionate brother .

text: I have the highest opinion in the world of Edward 's heart .
text_tokenized: I have the highest opinion in the world of Edward 's heart .

text: But you look grave , Marianne ; do you disapprove your sister 's choice ? " " Perhaps , " said Marianne , " I may consider it with some surprise .
text_tokenized: But you look grave , Marianne ; do you disapprove your sister 's choice ? " " Perhaps , " said Marianne , " I may consider it with some surprise .

text: Edward is very amiable , and I love him tenderly .
text_tokenized: Edward is very amiable , and I love him tenderly .

text: But yet -- he is not the kind of young man -- there is something wanting -- his figure is not striking ; it has none of that grace which I should expect in the man who could seriously attach my sister .
text_tokenized: But yet -- he is not the kind of young man -- there is something wanting -- his figure is not striking ; it has none of that grace which I should expect in the man who could seriously attach my sister .

text: His eyes want all that spirit , that fire , which at once announce virtue and intelligence .
text_tokenized: His eyes want all that spirit , that fire , which at once announce virtue and intelligence .

text: And besides all this , I am afraid , Mamma , he has no real taste .
text_tokenized: And besides all this , I am afraid , Mamma , he has no real taste .

text: Music seems scarcely to attract him , and though he admires Elinor 's drawings very much , it is not the admiration of a person who can understand their worth .
text_tokenized: Music seems scarcely to attract him , and though he admires Elinor 's drawings very much , it is not the admiration of a person who can understand their worth .

text: It is evident , in spite of his frequent attention to her while she draws , that in fact he knows nothing of the matter .
text_tokenized: It is evident , in spite of his frequent attention to her while she draws , that in fact he knows nothing of the matter .

text: He admires as a lover , not as a connoisseur .
text_tokenized: He admires as a lover , not as a connoisseur .

text: To satisfy me , those characters must be united .
text_tokenized: To satisfy me , those characters must be united .

text: I could not be happy with a man whose taste did not in every point coincide with my own .
text_tokenized: I could not be happy with a man whose taste did not in every point coincide with my own .

text: He must enter into all my feelings ; the same books , the same music must charm us both .
text_tokenized: He must enter into all my feelings ; the same books , the same music must charm us both .

text: Oh !
text_tokenized: Oh !

text: mama , how spiritless , how tame was Edward 's manner in reading to us last night !
text_tokenized: mama , how spiritless , how tame was Edward 's manner in reading to us last night !

text: I felt for my sister most severely .
text_tokenized: I felt for my sister most severely .

text: Yet she bore it with so much composure , she seemed scarcely to notice it .
text_tokenized: Yet she bore it with so much composure , she seemed scarcely to notice it .

text: I could hardly keep my seat .
text_tokenized: I could hardly keep my seat .

text: To hear those beautiful lines which have frequently almost driven me wild , pronounced with such impenetrable calmness , such dreadful indifference!"-- " He would certainly have done more justice to simple and elegant prose . I thought so at the time ; but you WOULD give him Cowper .

text: " Nay , Mamma , if he is not to be animated by Cowper!-- but we must allow for difference of taste . Elinor has not my feelings , and therefore she may overlook it , and be happy with him .
text_tokenized: " Nay , Mamma , if he is not to be animated by Cowper!-- but we must allow for difference of taste . Elinor has not my feelings , and therefore she may overlook it , and be happy with him .

text: But it would have broke MY heart , had I loved him , to hear him read with so little sensibility . Mama , the more I know of the world , the more am I convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love .
text_tokenized: But it would have broke MY heart , had I loved him , to hear him read with so little sensibility . Mama , the more I know of the world , the more am I convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love .

text: I require so much !
text_tokenized: I require so much !

text: He must have all Edward 's virtues , and his person and manners must ornament his goodness with every possible charm . " " Remember , my love , that you are not seventeen .
text_tokenized: He must have all Edward 's virtues , and his person and manners must ornament his goodness with every possible charm . " " Remember , my love , that you are not seventeen .

text: It is yet too early in life to despair of such a happiness .
text_tokenized: It is yet too early in life to despair of such a happiness .

text: Why should you be less fortunate than your mother ?
text_tokenized: Why should you be less fortunate than your mother ?

text: In one circumstance only , my Marianne , may your destiny be different from her 's ! "
